intro: Scurrula lepidota, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Scurrula lepidota is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are edible and have been used in traditional herbal remedies for their mild medicinal properties.
